Material used.Description: Western blot analyses were performed on lysates derived from Parkin doxycycline-inducible SH-SY5Y cells, HeLa cells, and HEK293E cells.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 Q126P mutation compromises Parkin translocation and mitophagic execution.
PINK1 L347P mutation compromises Parkin translocation and mitophagic execution.
PINK1 W437X mutation shows pronounced initial mitochondrial localization but compromises Parkin translocation.
PINK1 G309D mutation reduces binding to Parkin, affecting mitophagy.
Parkin K161N mutation does not affect binding to PINK1 but may have other functional deficits.
Parkin K211N mutation does not affect binding to PINK1 but may have other functional deficits.
Parkin T240R mutation does not affect binding to PINK1 but may have other functional deficits.
Parkin R275W mutation does not affect binding to PINK1 but may have other functional deficits.
Parkin G430D mutation does not affect binding to PINK1 but may have other functional deficits.

Biological replicates.Description: At least three independent experiments were performed for Western blot analyses.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 and Parkin constructs were used as positive controls for mitophagy and binding experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfections and scrambled siRNA were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed paired Student's t-test was used for statistical significance.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal mitophagy as indicated by complete clearance of mitochondrial markers after 24 h CCCP treatment in the presence of wild-type PINK1 and Parkin.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Impaired mitophagy as indicated by significant reduction in Parkin translocation or mitochondrial clearance after 24 h CCCP treatment.

Material used.Description: HeLa cells were used for immunofluorescence to analyze Parkin translocation and mitochondrial clustering.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 Q126P mutation shows reduced Parkin translocation to mitochondria upon CCCP treatment.
PINK1 L347P mutation shows reduced Parkin translocation to mitochondria upon CCCP treatment.
PINK1 W437X mutation shows pronounced mitochondrial localization but reduced Parkin translocation.
PINK1 G309D mutation likely reduces Parkin translocation, inferred from binding studies.
Parkin K161N mutation likely affects mitophagy at steps other than PINK1 binding.
Parkin K211N mutation likely affects mitophagy at steps other than PINK1 binding.
Parkin T240R mutation likely affects mitophagy at steps other than PINK1 binding.
Parkin R275W mutation likely affects mitophagy at steps other than PINK1 binding.
Parkin G430D mutation likely affects mitophagy at steps other than PINK1 binding.

Biological replicates.Description: At least three independent experiments were performed for immunofluorescence studies.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 and Parkin constructs were used as positive controls for Parkin translocation and mitochondrial clustering.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfections and scrambled siRNA were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantification of Parkin co-localization and mitochondrial clearance was performed as described previously.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal Parkin translocation and mitochondrial clustering observed in wild-type PINK1 and Parkin expressing cells after 2 h CCCP treatment.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in Parkin translocation or mitochondrial clustering after 2 h CCCP treatment.

Material used.Description: HEK293E cells were used for co-immunoprecipitation experiments to study PINK1 and Parkin interactions.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 Q126P mutation shows reduced binding to Parkin WT.
PINK1 L347P mutation shows reduced binding to Parkin WT.
PINK1 W437X mutation shows reduced binding to Parkin WT.
PINK1 G309D mutation shows reduced binding to Parkin WT.
Parkin K161N mutation binds to PINK1 WT similar to wild-type Parkin.
Parkin K211N mutation binds to PINK1 WT similar to wild-type Parkin.
Parkin T240R mutation binds to PINK1 WT similar to wild-type Parkin.
Parkin R275W mutation binds to PINK1 WT similar to wild-type Parkin.
Parkin G430D mutation binds to PINK1 WT similar to wild-type Parkin.

Biological replicates.Description: Four independent experiments were performed for co-immunoprecipitation studies.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 and Parkin constructs were used as positive controls for binding interactions.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfections were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Densitometric analysis using ImageJ software from four independent experiments, with significance assessed by two-tailed paired Student's t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Robust co-immunoprecipitation of PINK1 WT with Parkin WT.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in co-immunoprecipitation signal compared to PINK1 WT and Parkin WT interaction.
